title: Alex Jones Show Enhanced Edition - July 3, 2008 - Thu (COMPACT)
description:
The Alex Jones Show, Enhanced Edition

Veteran Broadcaster, Filmmaker, and Media Analyst Alex Jones brings you
thought-provoking interviews and takes an in-depth look at the news between the
daily headlines.

Alex is known for not just talking the talk, but walking the walk. He combines
his media presence with actual physical activism, a practice that once led to
him being arrested on the personal order of George W. Bush! Alex Jones has
gained international attention for standing up for what he believes in.

From La Prensa to the Wall Street Journal and USA Today, Jones has brought the
information war to the mainstream print media worldwide, speaking out against
tyranny in defense of the Constitution.

Jones has interviewed some of the most amazing minds and the most intriguing
personalities in the world from guerrilla journalists to government officials to
whistle-blowing intelligence agents.

The Alex Jones Show is a hard-hitting news and information program unlike any
other on the air. Jones is a seasoned investigative journalist who has broken
hundreds of national stories during his career. He is an aggressive
Constitutionalist who digs deeply into the facts to defend property rights, our
national borders, and the Second Amendment while he sends out a rallying call to
the American people to resist foreign entanglements and wars for corporate
interests. Jones eschews the bogus political labels of left and right and
instead focuses on what really matters: right and wrong.

Thursday, July 3rd, 2008

THE EMPIRE IS ON THE RUN..........All 4 PLUS Hours AND OVERDRIVE

Alex talks with former commanding general of the United States Army Intelligence
and Security Command, Albert Stubblebine, and his wife Rima E. Laibow, MD, about
Codex Alimentarius. Alex also welcomes Dr. Ron Paul. Special guest today is David
Icke, who recently announced he will run in Britain&#039;s parliamentary by-election.

Original capture by chakra (Sourced from the 32 Kbps live stream using Total
Recorder 7 Pro, or from the 42 Kbps podcast. Re-encoded to 32 Kbps @ 22.05 KHz.
Editing done using Nero WaveEditor 4 by hand. Four hours duration before
commercial edit takes it down to about 3 hours of playing time. Genre tag set to
Podcast for better ipod compatibility with bookmarking and chapter support).
Tags edited, edited pictures and show description with Mp3Tag and Winamp. Used
with permission. Alex Jones authorizes you to use and redistribute his materials
for non-profit, educational purposes:
